intro: Dipsacella pilosa, commonly known as the hairy woodruff, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy, slender stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Dipsacella pilosa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
